meanings.definition: Make (something) ineffective by applying an opposite force or effect.
meanings.sent1: The superhero's power to neutralises the villain's evil plans.
meanings.sent2: The antidote neutralises the poison in the body.
meanings.sent3: The magician's wand neutralises the enemy's spells with a flick.
meanings.sent4: Kindness can neutralises hatred like water extinguishing fire.
meanings.sent5: The antivirus software neutralises harmful viruses on the computer.

meanings.definition: Counteract (an acid or alkaline substance) by adding a neutralizing agent.
meanings.sent1: The base neutralises the acidity of the solution.
meanings.sent2: She used baking soda to neutralises the vinegar's sour taste.
meanings.sent3: The chef's secret ingredient neutralises the overly salty soup.
meanings.sent4: His calm demeanor neutralises the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: Adding sugar neutralises the bitterness of the coffee.
